title: Ruth Farmer. A story
author: Marchbank, Agnes.
snippet: In Lauriston there are three streets in the form of a triangle. One side of this triangle is called Graham Street, another Keir Street. The houses there are like most of the Lauriston houses—roomy and large and well-built.

title: Ruth Farmer. A story
author: Marchbank, Agnes.
snippet: The place is lively enough then. Keir Street has an advantage over Graham Street, inasmuch that the houses on the north side have from their back windows one of the finest views to be had in the city; for they stand high above the Grassmarket, and a view can be obtained embracing Queensferry and the coast to near Portobello, as well as the Fife hills. The Castle rock towers up before them, and the "ridge" on which, "piled deep and massy,"

title: My college days,
author: Tomes, Robert
snippet: and turbulence of his domestic establishment, I was soon comfortably domiciled in snug quarters in the lodgings in Graham Street, kept by a buxom, canny Scotchwoman, of the name of Munro. Next door to us lived a very old gentleman — a Mr. Ainslie.
